page.title: 09 VILLAGE CRICKET
page.content: In a game of cricket there are eleven players on each side. Amateur games have been played in villages for a many years and each league has its own particular rules as all matches are played in the evenings or on one day of the weekend. The players try to stick to the usual rules of the game but there are always small changes made to keep the game lively and interesting to everyone. The village teams score points and can make as many as 26 for each match. Sometimes the boundary is very close and the batsmen find it easy to make a high score. At other times the sheep or cattle have to be chased off the field, even during a match. At{Roadwater}they have to be careful that the ball is not lost in the river or the trees, and that any cars are parked well away from the pitch.
